Also inside: weak listings for Kwality Walls and Fractal, RBI’s tighter broker funding norms hitting capital-market stocks and F O volumes, JSW MG Motor’s expansion, and why change itself is accelerating.

articles.title: India’s first sovereign AI box aims to localise enterprise intelligence
articles.summary: Indian AI-native transformation foundry Arinox AI and agentic AI company KOGO, unveiled what they describe as India’s first sovereign AI product

articles.title: BJP's Ritu Tawde elected as Mumbai mayor, Shiv Sena’s Sanjay Ghadi becomes deputy mayor: All about them
articles.summary: The result was formally announced by BMC administrator Bhushan Gagrani in a special meeting that was called at the civic headquarters at 12 noon.

articles.title: High income tax collections show middle class is expanding, not being crushed: Sitharaman
articles.summary: Sitharaman said rising personal income tax collections reflect middle-class expansion and formalisation, not distress, citing a doubling of taxpayers, higher exemptions and record-low inflation.

articles.title: 'US tariff cut may lift GDP by 20-30 bps', say economists
articles.summary: India's economy is set for a boost as the US lowers tariffs on Indian goods. This move is expected to increase India's GDP by 20-30 basis points next fiscal year. Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

articles.title: Modi kicks off global AI summit in Delhi, over 35,000 delegates expected
articles.summary: Modi opens India AI Expo as Delhi hosts global summit with world leaders and over 35,000 delegates for one of the largest AI gatherings worldwide

articles.title: Trade deals a game changer for India's progress, says Piyush Goyal on India's 9 FTAs
articles.summary: India FTAs: India has secured preferential access to nearly 70 per cent of global trade markets through nine Free Trade Agreements with 38 developed nations. These pacts aim to boost self-reliance and economic development by 2047. Sensitive sectors have been protected while key industries like textiles and leather are set to gain new market entry.

articles.title: French authorities probe Nestlé, Danone, Lactalis over contaminated baby formula
articles.summary: Paris' public prosecutor said the inquiries target potential charges of “deception regarding goods posing a danger to human health," which carries penalties of up to seven years in prison and fines of up to €3.75 million ($4.45 million).

articles.title: KPMG Australia partner fined for using AI to cheat in AI ethics test
articles.summary: The partner, a registered company auditor, uploaded a training manual into an external AI platform to generate answers for a mandatory assessment in July 2025.

articles.title: India to get same yarn, cotton benefits as Bangladesh in US trade deal: Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal assures India’s textile and farm sectors are protected in the US trade deal, with reciprocal tariff cuts and equal cotton benefits as Bangladesh, targeting major export growth.

articles.title: Refinery petrochemical integration, feedstock certainty to define India’s next chemical growth cycle: Ramya Bharathram, MD, Thirumalai Chemicals
articles.summary: In an interview, she outlines reforms in cracker configuration, supply agreements and carbon strategy to move India up the global chemical value chain.

articles.title: Poonawalla Fincorp to raise up to ₹1,000 crore via NCD issue
articles.summary: Poonawalla Fincorp Limited will issue ₹1,000 crore secured NCDs, PFL NCD Series K2 FY2025-26, via private placement, listed on BSE Limited, with details in the key information document.

articles.title: Delhi’s Bhu-Aadhaar: How 14-Digit ULPIN digital mapping may transform land records
articles.summary: Delhi government launches Bhu-Aadhaar, assigning unique 14-digit ULPINs to land parcels. Rekha Gupta calls it a revolutionary step for Digital India, aiming to reduce disputes and modernise records.

articles.title: India AI Summit to address job risks, reskilling needs: MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: S Krishnan, Secretary at the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), said several companies have indicated interest in making investment announcements at the summit, adding that while the government has not specifically sought such declarations, announcements are expected.

articles.title: India ahead in digital revolution, PM Modi, Andhra CM playing key role: Bill Gates
articles.summary: Microsoft founder Bill Gates on Monday said India was ahead in the digital revolution and credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu with playing a key role in it.

articles.title: Why everyday care is key to building ‘Viksit Bharat’
articles.summary: The future of everyday care economy is a shared responsibility, where policymakers, healthcare professionals, pharmacists, corporates, not-for-profit, research bodies and consumers need to work together to nurture a healthier India, writes Manish Anandani, Managing Director, Kenvue India

articles.title: India-France Year of Innovation: Roads shut in South Mumbai on Feb 17; Check alternate routes
articles.summary: Check details on the best routes to take while travelling to and from South Mumbai on February 17, roads designated as no-parking zones, and other traffic changes.

articles.title: Data centres to be massive job creator: PM Modi
articles.summary: This comes a day before the PM opens the India AI Impact Summit and Expo at the Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. The high-powered event, being held from February 16 to 20, will be the first-ever AI summit hosted in the global south and is anchored in the three guiding principles of 'People, Planet, and Progress'.

articles.title: PM Modi to open 1.24-km, six-lane bridge over Brahmaputra in Guwahati, fuel Northeast growth
Argentina-India trade boost: Argentine envoy eyes deeper cooperation and economic growth
articles.summary: Argentine Ambassador Mariano Caucino highlighted that Argentina and India are set to deepen cooperation across numerous sectors, with trade volume expected to rise. Since becoming strategic partners in 2019, economic ties have grown significantly, with India now being Argentina's sixth-largest economic partner.

articles.title: MP govt announces ₹1.01 crore award named after Ujjain ruler Emperor Vikramaditya
articles.summary: Chief Minister Mohan Yadav also announced a national-level award of ₹21 lakh and three state-level awards of ₹5 lakh each in memory of the legendary ruler of Ujjain.

articles.title: US Ambassador Sergio Gor visits the Indian Army’s Western Command, briefed on Op Sindoor
articles.summary: Sergio Gor, accompanying USINDOPACOM Commander Adm Samuel J. Paparo, held substantive discussions with Lt Gen Manoj Kumar Katiyar, on strategic security dynamics along India’s Western Front.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs raises India FY27 growth forecast to 7% as policy uncertainty eases
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, also expects steady capital flows and a manageable current account deficit to support the macro outlook.

articles.title: Delhi CM lays foundation for infrastructure projects worth over ₹1,000 crore
articles.summary: Rekha Gupta laid foundation stones for ₹1,075 crore projects in Vivek Vihar, aiming to improve traffic, waterlogging, and infrastructure. Harsh Malhotra attended; Yamuna river divide is a priority.

articles.title: Startup financial modelling guide for founders
articles.summary: Learn how to build a startup financial model in India using bottom-up projections, runway planning, LTV:CAC and realistic growth assumptions.

articles.title: Torrent Power to acquire Nabha Power from L&T for ₹6,889 crore
articles.summary: Nabha Power owns and operates a 1,400 MW (2x700 MW) supercritical coal-fired thermal power plant at Rajpura in Patiala district, Punjab.

articles.title: BJP hits at Priyank for questioning RSS funding
articles.summary: Karnataka BJP rebukes Minister Priyank Kharge for questioning RSS funding and legality, urging focus on regional development and Congress's record.

articles.title: Delhivery bets bigger on electric deliveries after pilot cuts rider costs
articles.summary: The latest deployment follows a pilot in Delhi-NCR and Bengaluru, where the use of RIDEV’s electric two-wheelers reduced 4,260 kg of carbon dioxide emissions and cut riders’ daily operating costs by more than 50%.

articles.title: SC dismisses Abu Salem’s plea for premature release in 1993 Mumbai blasts case
articles.summary: Supreme Court rejected Abu Salem's early release plea, citing he hasn't served 25 years per extradition treaty, but let him approach High Court.

articles.title: American chipmaker Micron to begin commercial production in India by month-end: Meity official
articles.summary: Speaking at the IndiaAI Impact Summit, Krishnan said US-based Micron is working on high bandwidth memory, a key component necessary for widening AI usage.

articles.title: Tokyo to Mumbai: The Japanese are pouring big money into India
articles.summary: India has emerged as Japan's most promising market, driving significant Japanese investment. Mizuho Bank Global CEO Masahiko Kato highlighted a strategic push to build an India-Japan corridor, supporting businesses in both directions. This move capitalizes on India's vast market, robust growth, and digital prowess, contrasting with Japan's domestic constraints.

articles.title: India's tougher AI social media rules spark censorship fears
articles.summary: India has tightened rules governing the use of artificial intelligence on social media to combat a flood of disinformation, but also prompting warnings of censorship and an erosion of digital freedoms. With more than a billion internet users, India is grappling with AI-generated disinformation swamping social media.

articles.title: India Deep Tech Alliance pencils $1 billion for AI as members plan $2.5 billion play
articles.summary: The India Deep Tech Alliance (IDTA) is set to announce increased investments in the artificial intelligence and deeptech ecosystem on Tuesday. IDTA members have collectively committed more than $2.5 billion over five years, with $1 billion earmarked for AI deployment within three years, IDTA chair Arun Kumar told ET.

articles.title: India is becoming ElevenLabs’ key growth engine as enterprises scale voice AI: CEO Mati Staniszewski
articles.summary: India is already the second-largest market for ElevenLabs and is fast turning into one of its biggest growth engines, as enterprises scale voice artificial intelligence across customer service, sales and operations, the company’s cofounder and chief executive Mati Staniszewski said.

articles.title: D-Street’s new-age firms strike a profit note
articles.summary: Nine of India’s top 12 new-age firms grew revenues by 25% or more in October–December, driven by wider market reach and rising digital demand. Eternal, owner of Zomato and Blinkit, tripled its revenue, while Swiggy, Ather Energy, Lenskart, PB Fintech, Meesho and Nykaa saw 25–54% growth. Profits also rose at Nykaa, Eternal, Delhivery and Paytm.

articles.title: At mega AI Summit in Delhi, Goa seeks deeptech, semiconductor investments
articles.summary: Banking on the Centre's ambitious India AI Mission unveiled alongside a major industry summit in New Delhi, Goa is positioning itself as an emerging hub for artificial intelligence, deep-tech research and semiconductor-linked sectors, a state minister said on Monday.

articles.title: X outage: Users report website and app issues
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s social media platform X faced another outage, the second month in a row. Over 3,000 complaints were reported in India on Monday evening, with most users experiencing website issues, while others struggled with the app or feed. The cause remains unclear, and the company has not given an explanation.

articles.title: Indian AI, gaming startups take centre stage at AI Impact Summit 2026, showcasing cutting-edge innovations
articles.summary: Among the standout participants are five Indian ventures -- Yesgnome, Metasports (Hitwicket), Koyozo, Youth Buzz (Ourcadium) and Evivve -- each presenting unique AI-driven solutions that are reshaping gaming, creative production, and enterprise transformation.

articles.title: India hosts AI summit as safety concerns grow
articles.summary: "Child safety and digital harms are also moving up the agenda, particularly as generative AI lowers the barrier to harmful content," AI Asia Pacific Institute director Kelly Forbes told AFP. "There is real scope for change" although it might not happen fast enough, said Forbes, whose organisation is researching how Australia and other countries are requiring platforms to confront the issue.

articles.title: India plans AI 'data city' on staggering scale
articles.summary: As India races to narrow the artificial intelligence gap with the United States and China, it is planning a vast new "data city" to power digital growth on a staggering scale, the man spearheading the project says. - 'Whole nine yards' - Lokesh said the plan goes far beyond data connectivity, adding that his state had "received close to 25 percent of all foreign direct investments" to India in 2025.

articles.title: India 'very successful' emerging economy; right place to host AI summit: UN chief Guterres
articles.summary: In an exclusive interview with PTI at the UN Headquarters ahead of the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, Guterres underscored that Artificial Intelligence should benefit the entire world and not just be a privilege reserved for developed nations or two superpowers.

articles.title: India's textile and apparel exports down by 3.75% in January, outlook improves now with India US interim deal
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports saw a dip in January. High tariffs from the United States impacted shipments. However, a recent reduction in these tariffs is expected to boost export competitiveness. This change should support a recovery in textile and apparel shipments in the coming months. The sector's share in India's total exports also saw a decline.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

articles.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit widens to $34.68 billion in January as gold imports rise
articles.summary: India's trade deficit surged in January, driven by higher gold and silver imports. Merchandise exports saw a slight dip. However, overall goods and services exports are projected to exceed $860 billion for the fiscal year. Trade pacts with the UAE and EU offer future export growth opportunities. US tariff reductions are expected to boost Indian exports.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises marginally to 5% in January
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate rose to 5% in January. This increase was primarily seen in rural areas. The joblessness rate edged up from 3.9% to 4.2% in villages. Urban unemployment also saw a slight rise. Labour force participation and worker population ratios declined. Seasonal factors and post-harvest slack contributed to the rural slowdown. Urban areas remained stable.

articles.title: China's Russian oil imports to hit new record in February as India cuts back
articles.summary: China's Russian oil imports are set to reach a new record high in February, surpassing January's figures. Independent refiners are increasingly purchasing discounted Russian crude as India reduces its purchases, driven by concerns over potential U.S. strikes on Iran and the relative competitiveness of Russian supplies.

articles.title: India wholesale inflation at 9-month high of 1.81% in January; up from 0.83% in December
articles.summary: In January, India witnessed a surge in wholesale price inflation, hitting a nine-month high of 1.81%. This uptrend can be attributed to escalating costs across basic metals, manufactured goods, and agricultural sectors, with food inflation also on the rise. Concurrently, retail inflation edged up to 2.75%, driven by the rising costs of food and precious metals.

articles.title: A bite too big? Orchard anxiety for farmers as US apples could crowd Indian shelves
articles.summary: Apple cultivators in India stand at a crossroads as a recent trade agreement with the US and a surge in imported fruits jeopardise their existence. The local apple sector is grappling with soaring logistics expenses and significant losses post-harvest. There's an urgent call for transformative strategies to streamline supply chains and enhance productivity.

articles.title: India's sugar exports reach 2.01 lakh tonnes till February in 2026 MY: AISTA
articles.summary: India has exported over 200,000 tonnes of sugar by February in the current marketing year. The United Arab Emirates is the leading destination for these shipments. The government has approved a total of 2 million tonnes for export this year. This includes an additional 500,000 tonnes recently permitted. Sugar production is projected to increase significantly.

articles.title: India at a ‘defining moment’: Tech and trade to drive next growth phase, says Jitin Prasada
articles.summary: India is at a crucial economic juncture. Technology and trade are powering its growth. The nation is building robust digital infrastructure and promoting domestic manufacturing. Free trade deals are opening global markets. The government is committed to safeguarding citizens and supporting farmers and small businesses. India is poised for significant advancement.

articles.title: ET Now GBS 2026: Maharashtra $1-trillion push needed for India's $5-trillion economy quest
articles.summary: Placing the state's target alongside India's broader goal of becoming a $5-trillion economy by 2030 and a developed nation by 2047, state industry secretary P Anbalagan said Maharashtra's trajectory broadly mirrors national trends but will require a sharper push.

articles.title: Visible shift northern & Eastern districts power India's growth path
articles.summary: India's economy is growing beyond big cities. New areas in northern and eastern states are becoming economic hubs. This is according to the City Vitality Index for Q1 2026. Established metros still lead, but emerging districts are showing strong growth. This indicates a shift in economic activity across the country.

articles.title: India-Singapore ties in infra investment to get stronger; aviation vital to economy
articles.summary: Singapore's journey underscores the importance of global connectivity for economic advancement. The Changi Airport Group recognizes India's burgeoning infrastructure, especially in aviation. With substantial investments already flowing, Singapore is committed to collaborating and competing for opportunities within India's growth narrative. Together, both countries are driving towards improved infrastructure development.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Selective small & midcaps to outperform; focus on quality over momentum in 2026, says Siddhartha Khemka
articles.summary: Indian markets are shifting focus to company earnings and liquidity. The India-US trade deal has eased pressures. Investors are recalibrating strategies for 2026. Small and midcap stocks offer opportunities but require careful selection. Earnings visibility and balance sheet strength are key. Global trade and liquidity will guide market direction.

articles.title: High capability marks made-in-India LLMs
articles.summary: Here is a ready reckoner on the 12 AI startups/organisations which are building foundational AI models, backed by the IndiaAI Mission.

articles.title: Using AI to buy better golf gear
articles.summary: Ro Chawla. head of South Asia India sales, ST Microelectronics, said he uses AI, like ChatGPT, to improve his golf game by analysing swing speed, distance, and common issues. It suggests driver heads, shaft stiffness, and weight tailored to his profile. This approach narrows choices, making club selection faster, smarter, and far less confusing.

articles.title: Developers key architect of AI; India stands at the centre: OpenUK CEO Brock
articles.summary: Software developers are the invisible architects of the AI age, and India stands at the centre of this all, OpenUK CEO Amanda Brock said in an interview.

articles.title: DPI success, vast tech talent pool positions India strongly in AI: Senior Wipro exec
articles.summary: Ivana Bartoletti of Wipro said highlighted India's tech edge in terms of the vast talent pool, and said it placed the country in a good position to compete globally on AI. Bartoletti also noted that AI is bringing enormous advantages, and cited its transformative outcomes from advanced medical diagnostics to inclusive tools, helping children with disabilities learn and navigate.

articles.title: India can lead in making AI more accessible to Global South: BCG India MD & Partner Sidharth Madaan
articles.summary: India is well-positioned to make AI accessible to the Global South. The country has developed powerful open-source language models that can be adapted for various regions. However, India must quickly skill its young population and existing workforce in new technologies. This is crucial to convert its demographic advantage into a productivity advantage and avoid falling behind.

articles.title: AI has potential to reduce burden on healthcare workforce: Top govt official
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence will strengthen India's healthcare system. Union Health Secretary Punya Salila Srivastava highlighted AI's role in reducing workforce burden and enhancing patient care. India's digital health ecosystem is expanding, integrating AI into primary care. Initiatives like MadhuNetrAI and Cough Against TB are showcasing AI's potential for disease detection and early alerts.

articles.title: India's AI Summit sees long queues on opening day
articles.summary: India's AI Impact Summit in New Delhi encountered significant organisational problems on its first day. Attendees reported long queues, overcrowding, and unclear instructions. Security sweeps caused disruptions, leaving delegates scrambling. Poor signage and limited seating added to the confusion.

articles.title: AI Impact Summit begins; Anthropic India revenue run rate doubles
articles.summary: The much-anticipated India AI Impact Summit 2026 kicked off in New Delhi today. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India revenue run rate has doubled over the last four months: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei
articles.summary: Anthropic India’s revenue run rate has doubled over the last four months, said CEO Dario Amodei, adding that adoption of its Claude Code may have grown even faster among developers. In a conversation with Irina Ghose, managing director, Anthropic India, Amodei discussed the India opportunity, the growth of enterprise AI globally, and coexisting with AI systems.

articles.title: Alibaba launches Qwen3.5; claims cheaper model with advanced linguistic capabilities
articles.summary: Per Chinese tech giant Alibaba, the new version is designed to handle AI agent tasks and can process text, images, and video inputs. Lunar New Year is a period that has historically driven strong adoption of consumer internet apps in China.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: India bonds jump on US deal boost; profit-taking caps rise before RBI meet
articles.summary: Indian government bonds rallied early Tuesday following a U.S.-India trade deal, sparking hopes of increased foreign inflows due to a stronger rupee. However, profit-taking limited major moves as investors await the central bank's monetary policy decision. The benchmark 10-year bond yield eased after being pressured by high borrowing projections.

articles.title: Indian man accused of sexually assaulting child under 13 in US, ICE detains him
articles.summary: Vodela Yashaswi Kottapalli, an Indian national, is in US ICE custody in New Jersey facing charges of child sexual assault, larceny, and public disorder amid rising Indian deportations.

articles.title: AI disruption or reset opportunity? UBS, Nomura decode IT sell-off
articles.summary: With valuations correcting sharply and questions emerging around long-term growth, brokerage firms UBS and Nomura have offered diverging but nuanced views on whether the recent sell-off signals deeper risks or a potential opportunity.

articles.title: Why India’s cash in circulation hit ₹40 lakh crore despite record UPI surge? Check here
articles.summary: India’s currency in circulation hits ₹40 lakh crore, while UPI transactions reach ₹28.3 lakh crore monthly. SBI Research notes digital payments are driving incremental GDP growth amid rising cash.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises to 5% in January 2026
articles.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose to 5% in January 2026, with overall labour force participation rate (LFPR) at 55.9% and worker population ratio (WPR) at 53.1%. Urban and rural workforce participation remained largely stable as did female LFPR, month-on-month.

articles.title: India's trade deficit soars to record high as gold imports surge
articles.summary: For the April–January period, merchandise exports rose 2.22% to $366.63 billion, while imports climbed 7.21% to $649.86 billion, keeping the deficit elevated.

articles.title: Bill Gates meets Andhra CM Naidu in Amaravati ahead of AI Impact Summit; discusses health, agri, and tech
articles.summary: Bill Gates visited Amaravati, met Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu to discuss health, agriculture, and tech collaboration ahead of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 10-month high in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation rose to 1.81% in January from 0.83%, mainly due to higher food prices and increased manufacturing sector costs. Certain kitchen items remain significantly cheaper than a year ago.

articles.title: ‘Extremely concerned’ about global aid cuts: Rockerfeller’s Raj Shah warns of millions of needless deaths
articles.summary: As major countries like the US, UK and France execute deep cuts to their aid budgets and turn a blind eye to climate change, the world will become less capable of handling a pandemic or a major food crisis, Raj Shah, President of the Rockefeller Foundation, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. He warned that reduced global aid could cause 23 million deaths by 2030, affecting India. However, he saw some hope in private sector participation.

articles.title: January inflation at 2.75%: economists flag food risks, RBI likely to stay on pause
articles.summary: Sameer Narang, Head of Economics Research at ICICI Bank, said the shift in inflation trends is more notable than the headline print. He highlighted that food inflation has turned positive after months of deflation, while core inflation appears softer under the new series, particularly when gold and silver are excluded.

articles.title: New CPI series reflects changing spending patterns, may make inflation less volatile: CEA
articles.summary: CEA Anantha Nageswaran said the new CPI better reflects changing consumption patterns, may reduce inflation volatility, and improve monetary policy focus and budget predictability.

articles.title: India’s 10-minute delivery boom races ahead, but worker unrest exposes cracks in the platform story
articles.summary: As India’s quick commerce and food delivery platforms chase faster fulfilment and higher valuations, rising worker unrest is prompting difficult questions about sustainability, safety and the true cost of speed in the country’s platform economy.

articles.title: India’s new Consumer Price Index debuts February 12, January inflation likely near 3%
articles.summary: The revised CPI basket reduces the weight of food and raises the share of non-food items, potentially pushing January’s inflation print closer to 3% under the new series despite negative food inflation.

articles.title: HPE India's Bhawana Agarwal on what the country needs next to unlock AI
articles.summary: AI operating closer to citizens can enable faster responses at hospitals, transport hubs and service points. Built on platforms such as Aadhaar, UPI and DigiLocker, deeper AI integration can strengthen verification, improve fraud detection and reduce delays across government programmes, writes HPE India Managing Director Bhawna Agarwal.

articles.title: Infosys to outline AI roadmap at Investor Day on February 17
articles.summary: Infosys will unveil its AI strategy at Investor Day, with Salil Parekh addressing revenue growth amid concerns over AI disruption. Infosys shares fell 25.89% in the past year.

articles.title: Worried about AI taking your job? Experts say skill up, not stress out
articles.summary: Tech leaders at the AI Impact Summit 2026 urge professionals to stay calm and upskill as artificial intelligence reshapes jobs. Experts say lifelong learning, AI tool adoption and reskilling are vital as roles evolve, with new employment opportunities emerging across sectors, including healthcare and manufacturing.

articles.title: SEBI looks to curb volatility in Gold and Silver ETFs, proposes to review price band
articles.summary: SEBI proposes new price bands and cooling-off periods for ETFs to curb volatility, seeking public feedback after recent gold and silver market swings in January 2026.

articles.title: India among top three in AI readiness, but workforce fluency is key: Experts
articles.summary: With Indian CEOs accelerating investments in artificial intelligence, experts say the country’s ability to translate boardroom intent into workforce-wide AI capability will determine whether it can convert its global readiness ranking into long-term economic leadership.

articles.title: Siemens bets big on India as rail upgrades, data centres and AI fuel next industrial boom
articles.summary: German industrial major Siemens is sharpening its India focus as artificial intelligence accelerates factory automation and infrastructure investments. CEO Roland Busch says India’s capex cycle—from rail electrification to data centres—is positioning the country as a long-term manufacturing and digital engineering hub.

articles.title: HFCL bags ₹61 crore optical fibre cable orders from private telecom operator
articles.summary: HFCL Limited and HTL Limited secured orders worth ₹60.95 crore for optical fibre cables from a domestic telecom operator, boosting their telecom infrastructure pipeline for execution by May 2026.

articles.title: Cochin Shipyard bags Navy vessel contract worth ₹5,000 crore
articles.summary: The company emerged the lowest bidder (L1) for a tender floated by India’s Ministry of Defence to build five Next Generation Survey Vessels (NGSVs) for the Indian Navy. The contract is worth about ₹5,000 crore.

articles.title: Motilal Oswal Alternates hits final close of ₹8,500 crore for fifth private equity fund
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal Alternates closed India Business Excellence Fund V at ₹8,500 crore, its largest PE fund, attracting global investors and raising total AUM to over $3.3 billion by February 2026.

articles.title: BLS E-Services to buy 100% stake in Atyati Technologies for ₹154 crore
articles.summary: As per the exchange filling, the acquisition is expected to strengthen BLSe's banking relationships with key public sector banks and several private sector banks.

articles.title: Kwality Wall's targets distribution expansion, double-digit volume growth after listing
articles.summary: Kwality Wall’s is targeting double-digit volume growth supported by expansion across outlets and consumption growth. Management said margins may improve over time as investments scale. The listing follows the demerger of the ice cream business from Hindustan Unilever Ltd.

articles.title: Gold, silver ease in India: Key factors behind Monday’s fall
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India fell on MCX amid weak global trends, thin trading due to Presidents Day and Lunar New Year, profit-booking, and geopolitical tensions involving USS Gerald R. Ford.

articles.title: Nearly one-fourth of BMC winners face criminal cases, majority are crorepatis, says ADR report
articles.summary: According to the ADR report, party-wise data shows that 33% of winners from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) have declared criminal cases. This is followed by 24% from Shiv Sena and 15% from Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray).

articles.title: Rahul Gandhi hits out at govt over US-India trade deal: 'It's as if you've sold Bharat Mata'
articles.summary: Speaking in the Lok Sabha, Gandhi said, “We are moving into the era of war.” The world is experiencing the weaponisation of energy and finance, with both being used as strategic tools in global power struggles, he added.

articles.title: 'Not completely satisfied': Maithili Thakur questions minister Mangal Pandey over condition of govt hospital
articles.summary: Maithili Thakur, a celebrated folk singer, bagged her maiden election in November last year from the Alinagar seat after joining the BJP.

articles.title: Delhi records hottest day of year, maximum temperatures soar above normal
articles.summary: Safdarjung observatory, the city’s base station, recorded a maximum temperature of 31.6 degrees Celsius, which is 7.2 degrees above normal, says IMD

articles.title: From drought to disruption: Indian farmer bets ₹214 crore on AI-Powered Hydroponics
articles.summary: This Indian farmer lost everything to drought but now he’s back with a ₹214‑crore AI farming revolution.

articles.title: The ₹2–3 crore 'sweet spot': Why Indian homebuyers are closing deals in just 15 days
